In Boipatong itself on the night of the attack, can you just describe your role and what you did?

I went to work on the 17th of June, that was in the morning and I came back late in the evening and I found people coming out of the arena saying that they were going to Serele and I said: "Thank you for a long time I have been wishing that such a thing could happen, not knowing what to do seeing that I didn't have the power."
Why did you say thank you, why did you want to go to Boipatong?
I was very angry in those days as a result of the Boipatong problem, the death of people day in and day out.  My brother was killed there as well.  Those were the reasons that bothered me.
Apart from Boipatong, were you cross with the residents of other townships in the Vaal Triangle?

They too, we couldn't walk freely around the townships that were a distance from the hostel but because Boipatong was closer, killing us from just a distance, that is why I got so angry, overly angry.
And why did you want to attack the residents of Boipatong, or let me ask you this, who in Boipatong did you want to attack?
I wanted the so-called defence.  I didn't know this defence.
Do you know who are the people who supported the defence, as you call them?
It was the community of Boipatong.
Were you cross with the community of Boipatong as well?
Yes, but I very much wanted the actual people who were killing people in that area.
Now just to move a step back, at the stadium before you went to Boipatong, tell me who gave the order and what was the order.
I did not get that but I later on discovered that it was Damarra.  You see, I couldn't go to the stadium.
I had just arrived from work.
During that period did you work a normal day shift or what?
Yes, it was a day shift.  I was working during the day only, not in the evenings.
I working at the Sam Jam(?) contract.
Whilst you were in Boipatong, did you see any police or military vehicles?
No, not whilst we were inside Boipatong.
Did you see any military vehicles or police vehicles at a later stage?
There is one vehicle that I saw coming from the Vanderbijl Park direction, moving towards Sebokeng.
When did you see that vehicle?
At the time shortly after we exited from the township.

Now in Boipatong itself you say that you stabbed two people, the one died and the other ran away, can you just give particulars of these instances, starting with the instance where you killed somebody?
The situation resulted from circumstances in which I found myself.
Yes, just give more particulars about what you did in Boipatong.
My participation pertained to the killing of people or the dying of people at Boipatong.
Mr Mbatha, we understand from the affidavit that is before us that you stabbed a person who died and that the other person that you stabbed ran away, is that right?
What your counsel wants you to do is to tell us in your own words what you did in Boipatong, do you understand the question?

Yes.  I went into a house, broke a window to gain entry seeing that the doors were locked.  I found a girl who was trying to jump out of the window, I apprehended her and I asked her where the other comrades were and she said she didn't know.  I stabbed that instant and she fell.  I opened the wardrobe ...(intervention)
I stabbed her here.  I then opened the wardrobe ...(intervention)
Just indicate again where you stabbed her.
Okay, you are indicating just below the right ear in the vicinity of the collarbone, is that right?
Yes, but then I pointed or directed my spear downwards.
Do you know how old this girl you referred to was?
I would not say but she could have been my age.

We were frustrated by the fact that we could not locate the people we were looking for.  I was therefore infuriated because these are the people who get so excited when we get killed, they are the ones who are always found in the forefront.
When you asked her where the comrades are, did she say anything in reply?
After you stabbed her what happened to her?
Do you know where in Boipatong this incident took place?
I am not quite familiar with the area, I was there for the first time that evening.  I do not even know the streets, but there is one shop that is near the taxi rank and that is the area.
Was that shortly after you had entered Boipatong?
Did I understand you correctly, did this happen inside her house?
After that, did you leave the house?

I found two males in the wardrobe hidden there.  I then called upon Themba ...(end of tape) ... because they had trapped the doors to the wardrobe so that we could not open and they were shot from inside.
Do you know if they died or not?
They died because they collapsed and we could see their heads outside the wardrobe.
Did anything further happen in that specific house?
Now you also said that you stabbed another person but this person ran away, can you tell the Committee about this incident?

I found this person in this one particular house.  When we left that house just about to enter another house I saw him coming out trying to escape.  There was a Peugeot vehicle and he tried to conceal himself behind the vehicle.
	I noticed and I approached during which time he fled.  I chased him and he jumped over a fence and I stabbed him as he was jumping the fence.  He landed on the other side and he continued running.  I don't know what became of him.
This person, was it an elderly person, or can you just give an indication of the age of this person?
It was a person older than myself.  Even though it was at night I think he could have been older than myself.
Tell me generally, what was the situation with light in Boipatong, was it dark or could you see what you were doing, what was the situation?
Apart from the two instances you've referred now, were you personally involved in any other instances where people got killed or injured?
I would say yes, even though I was not directly involved.  I was doing that myself even though not directly killing someone.
What do you mean, did you see other people doing things or what?
We went into a house which was empty.  We searched inside and I found these people under a bed and I removed them.  It was a male as well as a female.  I pulled them out and Themba shot them.

Just to move a step back, you referred to a Peugeot, do you know where this Peugeot was parked in relation to the journey you followed through Boipatong?  Was it in the beginning of the attack when you saw the Peugeot or towards the end?
I saw it once we were inside Boipatong.

I am not in the position because I was just walking around not being able to tell in which area we were.
